intro: Lagunaria cuneiformis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf lagunaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found near water bodies. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and landscapes in suitable climates.
